page.title: 12FARMING - IDEN GREEN
page.content: {ORCHARDS:}Two at Yew Tree Farm, One at Hope House. A large area of orchard existed on the East side of Standen Street until the early 1970's when the land was sold off in small leisure plots to individual purchasers although no planning permission had been granted and the plots were virtually useless. Initially some purchasers visited their land to pick the{apples}but now the area is overgrown and derelict and it is impossible to envisage its future use. New orchards have been planted on the West side of Standen Street. Two{Cherry}orchards, one at West Cross, one at Iden Green have been grubbed out since 1980 owing the high labour costs. {SOFT FRUIT:} There is a{vineyard}at Laurel Nurseries, Dingleden, and {blackcurrants}at West Cross.
